newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Three groups bid for Portugal's Tabaqueira.
newsitem.headline: Three groups bid for Portugal's Tabaqueira.

text.p: Portuguese, Spanish and French companies bid in the privatisation of Portuguese tobacco company Tabaqueira, a senior finance ministry official said.

The bids were submitted by Spanish firm Tabacalera, in partnership with Portugal's Empresa Madeirense de Tabacos, as well as French tobacco company Seita and Portugal's Jorge de Mello industrial group, said Jose Martins de Sa, president of the jury presiding over the privatisation.

The bids for a 65 percent stake of Tabaqueira, delivered to the offices of the Inspectorate General of Finance in Lisbon on Monday evening, will be formally opened in a public ceremony at 0900 GMT on Tuesday.
The government plans to sell the stake by public competition at a minimum price of 4,650 escudos per share.
